intro: Minuartia dichotoma, commonly known as the two-branched rockcress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial that typically thrives in rocky or sandy soils. The plant features small, pale green leaves that are opposite and often divided, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are tiny, white or pale yellow, and appear in clusters near the base of the plant. Minuartia dichotoma is often found in arctic, alpine, or coastal regions, where it adapts to harsh environmental conditions.
